physical_appearance:This is a drawn map of the Malayan Contact Network establised by the Allied Commandos. The title is inscribed on the left side of the map. It shows a part of Peninsula West Malaya
 labelling several points in both English and Chinese
 with a network drawn between points. The map is in black and white.

sgcool_label_text:This drawing belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. \r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.\r\n\r\nThis map is a depiction of the Malayan Contact Network Established by the Allied Commandos in 1943. \r\n

It shows a part of Peninsula West Malaya, labelling several points in both English and Chinese, with a network drawn between points. The map is in black and white.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This drawing belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from mid 1990s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerrillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.

This map is a depiction of the Malayan Contact Network Established by the Allied Commandos in 1943.
